Package org.diirt.service

Support for command/response type services.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ServiceProvider
    Provides a set of services that can be registered to the framework.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractFileServiceProvider
    A service provider that can create a service instance for each file in the configuration directory.
    Service
    Provides access to command/response type of communication for sources of data or RPC-like services.
    ServiceDescription
    A utility class to gather all the elements that define the service.
    ServiceMethod
    A call that provides access to command/response type of communication for sources of data or RPC-like services.
    ServiceMethod.DataDescription
    The full description of an argument of a result of the service.
    ServiceMethodDescription
    A utility class to gather all the elements that define the service method.
    ServiceRegistry
    Main entry point for service lookup.

Package org.diirt.service Description

Support for command/response type services.

A client can find services through the ServiceRegistry, which in turn uses the ServiceLoader to find suitable ServiceProvider. This means that adding the correct jar to the classpath is enough to enable the support for the given service. Once a service and a service method is identified, the client can execute the method synchronously or asynchronously (preferred), with a call to ServiceMethod#execute(java.util.Map, java.util.function.Consumer, java.util.function.Consumer) or ServiceMethod#syncExecute(java.util.Map) . All objects are thread-safe.

A service provide can create ServiceMethod implementations, group them into Services. The description classes are used to gather data during service creation, so that the result remains immutable and thread-safe. A ServiceProvider should be created as well, and properly registered through the ServiceLoader so that all clients can simply find the implementation through the registry.
